intro: Hieracium echioides subsp. asiaticum, commonly known as the Asian spear thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage with a distinctive, often prickly texture. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped with serrated edges, and the flowers are yellow, forming a dense cluster at the top of the stem. It is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
